chunk_prompt: Summarize this content about Topic: er, infection, like:
final_prompt: Summarize this content about Topic: er, infection, like:

sentences.text: i had a friend who fell out of a chair at a work party and hit their head hard on the ground.
started complaining about vision problems over the next several weeks.
long story short, it was a serious tbi.
before i was admitted to the icu for 2 weeks i had muscle tetany (felt like pins/needles) in my feet, arms, chest and weirdly enough what felt like my nose for weeks.
thought it was just poor circulation and turns out i had undetectable potassium and phosphate levels which did bad damage to my liver and kidneys!!
i went months without going to the er because i thought i was being dramatic.
also for those that are biologically female, losing your period or prolonged amenorrhea is oftentimes a sign of something larger going on thats attributed by doctors as stress.
if you’ve recently taken an impact to the abdomen, pain in the left shoulder can signify a ruptured spleen (though you’ll most likely experience other symptoms).

chunks.raw_summary: i had undetectable potassium and phosphate levels which did bad damage to my liver and kidneys . i went months without going to the er because i thought i was being dramatic . losing your period or prolonged amenorrhea is oftentimes a sign of something larger going on .
chunks.cleaned_summary: went months without going to the er because thought was being dramatic. losing your period or prolonged amenorrhea is oftentimes a sign of something larger going on.
